page_analysis.text_content:
Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

• Fireplaces shall be included in the gross floor area (counted one time) regardless of configuration or design.

• Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area regardless of configuration or design.

Fig 14 Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, etc.

Chimneys on the upper floors DO NOT COUNT

All configurations of fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses COUNT ONCE towards the gross floor area.

Note: Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated like accessory structures; they and count towards FAR if they are greater than 120 sf. They count towards lot coverage always, regardless of size.

Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses, etc., that are greater than 5' in height, DO COUNT toward gross floor area. (Note: Neither appendages like this nor noise-producing equipment may be located in the required yards)

Note: In 2000, the city of Palo Alto passed an ordinance prohibiting the construction of new wood-burning fireplaces. For details about and possible prohibition, see the Chapter 9.06.030

19

visual_elements.description: Isometric architectural drawing showing a house with various projections including chimneys, fireplaces, and miscellaneous appendages. The diagram illustrates which elements count toward gross floor area calculations. Shows chimneys on upper floors (labeled as DO NOT COUNT), fireplaces and buttresses at ground level (labeled as COUNT ONCE), and a separate small structure with height indicator showing miscellaneous appendages greater than 5' in height.

technical_specifications.parameter: Height threshold for sheds, planters, and projections

structural_elements.main_heading: Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

additional_notes: Gray shaded box contains the main bullet point rules
Multiple notes and annotations within the diagram
Page appears to be from a technical planning manual

conditions.text: Fireplaces shall be included in the gross floor area (counted one time)
Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area
Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated like accessory structures; they and count towards FAR if they are greater than 120 sf
Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses, etc., that are greater than 5' in height, DO COUNT toward gross floor area
Neither appendages like this nor noise-producing equipment may be located in the required yards
Chimneys on the upper floors DO NOT COUNT
All configurations of fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses COUNT ONCE towards the gross floor area

logical_relationships.expression: Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area regardless of configuration or design
Fireplaces not connected to the house count towards FAR if greater than 120 sf AND count towards lot coverage always
Miscellaneous appendages greater than 5' count toward gross floor area AND may not be located in required yards

execution_sequence.action: Include all fireplaces in gross floor area calculation
Evaluate height of sheds, planters, and projections
Determine if fireplaces are connected to house
Apply lot coverage rules for detached fireplaces
Evaluate miscellaneous appendages for height and location restrictions
